1.text: What type of content is (ADULT) uncomfortable with (CHILD) seeing/hearing?

2.text: What types of content makes (CHILD) uncomfortable?

4.text: Pause to consider who we are giving our information to and how that information could be used or sold

6.text: (CHILD), do you agree to talk to (ADULT) when this happens?

7.text: Do not give names, addresses, phone numbers or other information without talking to an adult first

8.text: Communicate my boundaries to others when necessary

9.text: Technology lets us do so many awesome activities. (CHILD)'s device can be used for:

10.text: Follow people and accounts that make us happy

11.text: Close out of videos, sites or games that make us feel uncomfortable

12.text: Remove ourselves from digital situations that bring us down

14.text: (CHILD) can you agree that when if you see something that doesn't make you feel good we can have a conversation about it?

15.text: How will (CHILD) budget their screen time?

16.text: (CHILD), what are three physical activities you enjoy?

17.text: Set social media accounts to Private or Unlisted

18.text: (CHILD), what are three activities you enjoy to get your heart pumping and body moving?

19.text: Be open and honest with each other when are struggling

21.text: (CHILD), do you agree to talk to (ADULT) or another trusted adult when you feel like you can't handle these situations on your own?

22.text: (CHILD) what are three things you do with your technology that make you feel good about yourself?

23.text: Create parent accounts when an app or website requires us to

24.text: Create and use seperate "kid profiles" on apps like Netflix or Hulu

25.text: Does (CHILD) need (ADULT) to approve EACH piece of content they share?

26.text: Who will (CHILD) be allowed to communicate with through their device?

27.text: (ADULT), what are three things you do with your technology that make you feel good about yourself?

28.text: We all make mistakes online from time to time! (ADULT), do you agree to use mistakes as learning opportunities?

29.text: What types of content make (CHILD) uncomfortable?

30.text: (ADULT), do you promise to listen with an open mind and do your best to support (CHILD)?

31.text: (CHILD) and (ADULT), what else can you agree to do to keep your bodies healthy?

32.text: Do not give names, addresses, phone numbers or other information without talking to a trusted adult first

33.text: (ADULT), how will you stay accountable for following the rules? What happens if YOU break the agreement?

34.text: Not everything we see online is true. (CHILD), do you agree to ask a trusted adult if you have questions about what you see online?

35.text: When would we like to be device-free?

36.text: Wait until age of 13 to create acccounts using child's information

37.text: Not everything we see online is true. (CHILD), do you agree to talk to a trusted adult if you have questions about what you see online?

38.text: Remind myself that 'going viral' is not worth hurting anyone's feelings, person, property or future (including my own!)

50.text: (CHILD), do you agree to talk to (adult) or another trusted adult when you feel like you can't handle these situations on your own?

65.text: Celebrate our unique qualities instead of comparing ourselves to others

145.text: Use an alarm clock so your phone doesn't need to be near your bed

147.text: Charge phone overnight in a different room of the house

151.text: Remind myself that 'going viral' is not worth hurting anyone's feelings, person, property or future (including my own!)
